Description: Papyrus. Early demotic letter. Nineteen lines on the recto and two on the verso (the papyrus have been turned over from bottom to top). The top, bottom and right-hand margins are preserved, but there has been some damage to the left-hand side, which affects the ends of the lines in the middle and lower half of the papyrus.
Curator's comments: Under study by Naglaa Ezzeldeen (Helwan University, Cairo).
Letter is from Pakhaau (?) son of Hapertais to his mistress (name unclear). He complains that she has not written to him about various matters.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380989) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380989)
